newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kloeckner & Co to restructure, focus on PCs, steel.
newsitem.headline: Kloeckner & Co to restructure, focus on PCs, steel.

text.p: German trading and services group Kloeckner & Co AG, a subsidiary of diversified industry group Viag AG, said on Monday it planned to sell two of its five divisions and refocus its business.

The company said in a statement that its future business would concentrate on steel and metals trading activities and that it would transfer its personal computer products unit Computer 2000 to the Viag group.
Kloeckner & Co said that the move should be seen in the context of Viag's policy goal to concentrate on businesses where it can have a leadership position in the marketplace.
Only Kloeckner & Co's steel and metal trading activities and the Computer 2000 group fulfil this goal, while the chemical, textile and mobile construction units did not.

These activities "will be brought into strong partnerships with a perspective for the future. It is intended to give the corresponding pattern industrial leadership. The long term goal is to sell the divisions," said a Kloeckner & Co spokesman.
As a result of these organisational changes, Kloeckner & Co will no longer need to provide a holding company to manage its steel and metals trading businesses and Computer 2000.
The PC unit will instead be separated from Kloeckner & Co and the two companies will be placed in the Viag group's logistics division.
Viag will then take over direct control of Computer 2000 and the logistics division will consist of Kloeckner & Co, Computer 2000 and Kuehne & Nagel.
The restructuring should be completed within the next 12 months, the company said.
